Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli 25922 (MIC=2 µM), Salmonella typhimurium 14028 (MIC=2 µM), S. typhimurium DT104 700408 (MIC=2 µM), Salmonella enteritidis 13076 (MIC=2 µM), Klebsiella pneumoniae 13883 (MIC=1 µM);Gram-positive bacteria:Listeria monocytogenes 19115 (MIC=2 µM), Staphylococcus aureus 25923 (MIC=1 µM), S. aureus (MRSA) 43300 (MIC=1 µM), S. aureus (MRSA) BAA-39 (MIC=1 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Structure Description: NMR spectroscopy reveales that fowlicidin-3 comprises 27 amino-acid residues and adopts a predominantly alpha-helical structure extending from residue 9 to 25 with a slight kink induced by a glycine at position 17..
Sequence Information.Function: May have antimicrobial activity and play a role in the innate immune response.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Detected in bone marrow, liver and lung.

Literature.Title: Chicken cathelicidin-B1, an antimicrobial guardian at the mucosal M cell gateway.
Literature.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 2007 Sep 18;104(38)15063-15068.
Literature.Author: Goitsuka R, Chen CL, Benyon L, Asano Y, Kitamura D, Cooper MD.

Literature.Title: Identification and functional characterization of three chicken cathelicidins with potent antimicrobial activity.
Literature.Author: Xiao Y, Cai Y, Bommineni YR, Fernando SC, Prakash O, Gilliland SE, Zhang G.

Literature.Title: Fowlicidin-3 is an alpha-helical cationic host defense peptide with potent antibacterial and lipopolysaccharide-neutralizing activities.
Literature.Author: Bommineni YR, Dai H, Gong YX, Soulages JL, Fernando SC, Desilva U, Prakash O, Zhang G.
